statement: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at sea level.
The Earth revolves around the Sun.
Humans have 206 bones in their adult bodies.
The chemical symbol for gold is Au.
Light travels faster than sound.
The mitochondrion is known as the powerhouse of the cell.
There are eight planets in the Solar System.
The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
Oxygen makes up about 21% of Earth's atmosphere.
The atomic number of carbon is 6.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain on Earth.
The Amazon River is the second longest river in the world.
Africa is the second largest continent by area.
Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country.
The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world.
Russia is the largest country by land area.
Australia is both a country and a continent.
The Nile River flows northward.
Antarctica is the coldest continent on Earth.
The Declaration of Independence was signed in 1776.
World War II ended in 1945.
Julius Caesar was assassinated in 44 BCE.
The Berlin Wall fell in 1989.
The Wright brothers flew the first powered airplane in 1903.
Abraham Lincoln was the 16th president of the United States.
The Roman Empire officially fell in 476 AD.
The French Revolution began in 1789.
The Titanic sank in 1912.
The Great Fire of London occurred in 1666.
William Shakespeare wrote Romeo and Juliet.
The word 'emoji' comes from Japanese.
The Iliad and the Odyssey are attributed to Homer.
The English alphabet has 26 letters.
“Bonjour” means “hello” in French.
Moby-Dick was written by Herman Melville.
The Latin alphabet is used in most Western languages.
The Harry Potter series was written by J.K. Rowling.
The Nobel Prize in Literature was first awarded in 1901.
“Hola” means “hello” in Spanish.
A triangle has three sides.
Pi is approximately equal to 3.14159.
Zero is an even number.
The Pythagorean theorem applies to right-angled triangles.
A circle has 360 degrees.
Prime numbers are only divisible by 1 and themselves.
The square root of 64 is 8.
2 to the power of 3 equals 8.
An octagon has eight sides.
The Fibonacci sequence begins with 0 and 1.
The first iPhone was released in 2007.
Python is a programming language.
The internet was originally developed by the U.S. Department of Defense.
HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
A byte is made up of 8 bits.
Linux is an open-source operating system.
The World Wide Web was invented by Tim Berners-Lee.
JavaScript is primarily used for web development.
Google was founded in 1998.
A GPU is used for graphics processing.
The Beatles were a British rock band.
The Marvel Cinematic Universe began with Iron Man in 2008.
The Godfather was directed by Francis Ford Coppola.
Michael Jackson is known as the “King of Pop.”
The Simpsons is the longest-running American animated TV show.
Beyoncé was a member of Destiny’s Child.
Netflix was founded as a DVD rental service.
The Oscars are formally known as the Academy Awards.
Walt Disney created Mickey Mouse.
Friends aired for 10 seasons.
Dolphins are mammals.
Penguins cannot fly.
A group of lions is called a pride.
The blue whale is the largest animal on Earth.
Kangaroos are native to Australia.
A honeybee can sting only once.
Elephants have the largest brains of any land animal.
Cats are obligate carnivores.
Coral reefs are made from living organisms.
A panda’s diet consists mostly of bamboo.
